name: pitch-deck-reviewer
description: Inspired by u/duygudulger — reddit.com/r/startups/comments/1pylg24. Paste your pitch deck text and get a slide-by-slide teardown across 8 categories: problem slide strength, traction context, market sizing, team positioning, ask clarity, storytelling, visual/design signals, and common anti-patterns. Every critique references your actual content and includes specific rewrites.

deck_content.description: Your pitch deck content. Paste the text from each slide, ideally labeled (Slide 1: ..., Slide 2: ...). Include all text: headlines, bullet points, numbers, footnotes. The more complete, the better the review.

company_context.description: What does your company actually do? One paragraph. This helps judge whether the deck communicates it clearly.

stage.description: Your fundraising stage. Expectations differ: pre-seed can lack traction, Series A cannot.

ask_amount.description: How much you're raising (e.g. '$1.5M'). Helps evaluate whether your ask slide makes sense.

intensity.description: How harsh should the feedback be?

review.description: The full slide-by-slide review as flowing text. Quotes actual deck content. Covers all 8 categories with clear transitions.

problem_score.description: How compelling is the problem slide? Does it make investors lean forward?

traction_score.description: Is traction presented with context (growth rate, unit economics) or just vanity numbers?

market_score.description: Is market sizing based on real math or copy-pasted Statista numbers?

team_score.description: Does the team slide answer 'why you, why now'?

ask_score.description: Is the fundraising ask tied to specific milestones?

storytelling_score.description: Does the deck tell a clear narrative? Clarity over cleverness.

design_signals_score.description: Do formatting, consistency, and slide density signal competence?

anti_patterns_found.description: List of specific anti-patterns detected (e.g. 'Uses platform', 'Uber for X analogy', 'Font size too small')

verdict.description: One punchy sentence summarizing the deck

top_fix.description: The single most impactful change to make before sending this to investors
